comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content:
Mrs. Julian Heath was the founder and president of the National Housewives League, New York, "organized to uphold the enforcement of laws which affect food supplies, the family health, the cost of living, and to bring about necessary legislation in these matters. The movement is educational, defensive and constructive." 

Mrs. Charles E. Griffin was the organization's secretary.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Mrs. Heath holds a copy of the Housewives' League Magazine, a sophisticated, illustated publication, which may now be read online. Here is volume 5, from 1915: www.archive.org/stream/housewivesleague00housrich#page/n5... In 1913, Mrs. Heath's report on the work of the Housewives League was published in the "Annals of the American Academy of Political and Social Sciences": books.google.com/books?id=nlY5AAAAMAAJ&pg=RA1-PA121&a... julian heath&f=false

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo of the pair. Mrs. Heath still holds the magazine, but is not pretending to read it:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4605958987/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC -- "Julian" is spelled with only one "L," please.
